definition: to disappear/to vanish/to eliminate/to spend (time)/have to/need
scattered/loose/to come loose/to fall apart/leisurely/powdered medicine
to scatter/to break up (a meeting etc)/to disperse/to disseminate/to dispel/(coll.) to sack

sentences.english: Watching her walk away, I felt the enchantment of the night begin to evaporate.
sentences.chinese: 看着她走遠，我頓感夜色的迷人開始消散。

sentences.english: The tousled clouds have dispersed from the sky.
When the fog of battle lifted, Colla bodies littered the landscape.
sentences.chinese: 當戰爭的迷霧消散，科拉人屍橫遍野。

sentences.english: New mechanic called vanishing which uses time counters on permanents.
sentences.chinese: 有個名爲消散的機制會在永久物上使用計時指示物。

sentences.english: The hot day air dispersed with the evenfall.
sentences.chinese: 白天的熱氣隨着黃昏的到來而消散。

sentences.english: I think the cloud will lift soon.
sentences.chinese: 我想雲很快就會消散的。

sentences.english: Factor Market, Property Rights and Transaction Costs, Government.
sentences.chinese: 交易費用，政府管制和租值消散。
可是最後還是如霧般消散。

sentences.english: The dark clouds hanging over the relations between the two countries will quickly vanish.
sentences.chinese: 籠罩着兩國關係的陰雲會迅速消散。

sentences.english: Individual plights vanish in these here shadows.
sentences.chinese: 一己的憤懣消散在這些影子中。

sentences.english: The opacity disappeared gradually in 5 weeks in 83.6% of the patients.
sentences.chinese: 患者在5周內肺部陰影逐漸消散。

sentences.english: It vaporises, within a second as though it had never existed.
sentences.chinese: 彷彿從來不曾存在，瞬間便蒸發消散，無影無蹤。

sentences.english: For example, key money is used to minimize dissipation of rent under rent control. (2)
sentences.chinese: 例如，在價格管制下的匙金便是減低租值消散的方法。

sentences.english: Without myelin, the signal leaks and dissipates.
sentences.chinese: 沒有髓鞘的話，電訊號就會漏流而消散。

sentences.english: The fog dissipated when the sun rose.
sentences.chinese: 當太陽昇起時霧漸漸消散。
她的財產慢慢消散殆盡。

definition: to vanish like smoke in thin air/to disappear
(literary) to eliminate/to put an end to
to change into/to turn into/to become
